text: Our first thought: DR. DOOM?  But it's not moving.  A welder's torch sparks into frame in the hands of a sculpt on scaffolding.  This is art, an epic 20 foot statue goin of a business mogul (VICTOR VON DOOM) in whose generously extended hands sit two intertwined columns of DNA.  His f is chiseled, angular, perfect (too perfect).  Past sparks MOVE down to pick up...
REED RICHARDS and BEN GRIMM head toward the soaring glass atrium of VDI Headquarters.  Designed to inspire awe, it does.
High open space, exposed structural elements.  Obviously aimed at first time visitors to create feelings of... smallness, inadequacy.
Ben glances at Reed, who looks a little nervous.
Good thing it ain't workin... Reed, what are we doing here?  This guy's fast-food, strip-mall science --
This wasn't our first stop, in case you forgot NASA.  And Victor's not that bad.  He's just a little... (seeing the statue) Larger than life.
They move past the statue, into the sprawling atrium.
He's financed some of the biggest breakthroughs of this century.
You'd never know it.

He motions to a high-tech ORB, showing FOOTAGE of VDI's accomplishments: a safe and clean nuclear facility, the f private Space Station. All images have VICTOR front and center, glad-handling Ge Bush, Tony Blair, shady International Leaders.  The last image is Victor holding the AMERICA'S CUP.
Jesus.  That too?
They reach three stern RECEPTIONISTS.
Reed Richards and Ben Grimm to see --
A receptionist cuts him off, handing them each a pass.
Executive elevator, top floor.
What's the price for a smile round here?
They head for the elevator.  Reed carries a small, black As they enter the elevator, steel doors shut and we CUT T
A large, dark office.  Ben in the corner.  He yawns, watches... BRIGHT HOLOGRAMS: Stars.  Planets.  They hover in the air making the room feel like a majestic portal into outer sp
My research suggests that exposure to a high-energy cosmic storm born on solar winds might have triggered the evolution of early planetary life.
REED stands among the holograms, speaking to a MYSTERIOUS FIGURE in shadow behind a desk.  An ominous, PULSATING RE CLOUD covers the stars.  It washes over a hologram of EAR

In six weeks another cloud with the same elemental profile will pass Earth's orbit.  A study in space could advance our knowledge about the structure of the human genome, and help cure countless diseases, extend human life --
The SHADOW clears his throat.  Reed speeds up, emotional.
Give kids the chance to be stronger, healthier, less prone to --
Turn it off.  Please.
The figure's DEEP VOICE pierces the darkness.
But I haven't fully explained my --
Yes you have... Imagination. Creativity.  Passion.  Those were always your trademarks.

Lights brighten, revealing the face behind the voice: VIC VON DOOM.  35, handsome, commanding.  He looks almost... airbrushed.  He drops a WIRED magazine to the desk.  REED on the cover over the words: RICHARDS BANKRUPT, GRANT
But dreams don't pay the bills, do they? (a condescending smile) Same old Reed, the hopeless optimist.  Still reaching for the stars, with the world on your back.
You remember in school we talked about working together.  That's what I was about to explain...
Reed presses the remote.  Another hologram appears: A SHU slowly approaching AN ORBITING SPACE STATION.  Both bear VON DOOM INDUSTRIES logo.  Victor smiles, more intrigued.
So it's not my money you want.  It's my toys... Tell me: if NASA doesn't trust you, why should I?
Victor is a step ahead.  Reed pauses, thrown for a beat. wakes up, suspicious.  Victor notices.  He notices everything.
That's my job.  To stay a step ahead.  To know what other men don't.
Ben gets close to Reed, turning toward the door.
I can't take this.
(low, quiet) Ben.  This is business.  Just work.
A beat.  Victor cracks a smile, enjoying the tension.  An
He's right, Ben.
They turn to see...SUE STORM (demure, stunning) standing corner...possibly for the whole presentation.  A little c
It's just business.
I think you both know my Director of Genetic Research, Susan Storm.
Heya Susie. (under breath, to Reed) One more thing he's got.
Sue gracefully walks into the office, only taking her eye off of Reed to give Ben a warm hug.
Ben, it's been too long.
She gives Reed a polite handshake.  Victor watches carefu Reed looks uncomfortable in her gaze.  A little tongue-ti
You're, you've, I mean, how have you bee--
Never better.
Victor sizes them up.  He puts a hand on Sue's shoulder.
This isn't going to be a problem, is it?
Not at all.
Ancient history.
Victor smiles, eyeing Sue.

Good.  Then you're just in time to hear the great Reed Richards ask me for help. (to Reed) You know, you made a lot of folks at MIT feel like a junior high science fair.  So you'll excuse me if I savor the moment.
Ben tightens.  A hard beat.  Reed sucks it up.
You back this mission, and I'll sign over a fair percentage of any applications or --
The number's seventy-five.  And it's applications and patents.
What about his first born?
(quiet) Ben, the money's not important.  We could save lives.
Sue gives a thin smile -- a flicker of old feelings.
Twenty-five percent of a billion is enough to keep the lights on, isn't it?  Maybe even pay off your fourth mortgage on the Baxter Building.
They look at Victor.  How does he know all this...?
Deal...?
Reed looks at Ben, who shakes his head softly no.  But Reed...drops a nod.  Done.  Victor smiles, offers a handshake.
Well then, to our future.  Together.
Victor squeezes.  Hard.  His other hand on Sue's shoulder
Funny how things turn out, isn't it?
Hilarious.
As Reed and Sue lock eyes, Ben watches Victor.  Wary.
Director of Communications LEONARD enters, checking files
If Reed's right, then this little trip will double our stock offering.
And if he's not...?
Reed's always right.  Good thing he doesn't always know what he's got...
Reed and Ben step into the elevator.
He knew about NASA.  What if he made the call to shut us down --
Ben, think about all the people we can help if this works --
Maybe you should think about yourself for once.  You always let this guy push you round --
We got what we wanted.  That's enough.
I know, I know.  I'm just worried about what he wants... Speaking of which...
Reed follows Ben's eyes to...SUE.  She joins them.  Doors shut.
You sure about this, Reed?
He nods, head down.  He doesn't want eye contact.
Those solar winds are flaring, but I factored them into my coordinates and --
I was talking about us.  Working together.
Sue holds her eyes on Reed.  He is clearly uncomfortable her gaze.  Did the elevator just get smaller?

(thinking, talking fast) Well, uh, based on our history...you can handle the biogenetics, and I'll focus on the molecular physics.  Or, uhm, maybe I should take the biotech, you work the microscopes, since you have some background in electropho--
(droll, a little annoyed) Right.  That's exactly what I meant.
She shakes her head -- same old Reed.  He looks at her -- what did he say wrong?  Ben smiles, patting Reed on the shoulder.
Way to not overthink it. (to Sue) So when do we leave?
I'll schedule the launch.  Call me in the morning to talk about resources and crew.
She offers a business card.  Reed doesn't take it.
I, uh, think I remember the number.
It's been changed.
Beat.  Ben grimaces.  Reed takes the card, his eyes down.
As far as crew, I was hoping Ben could pilot the mission --
Well, he's welcome to ride shotgun, but we already have a pilot on our payroll.  You remember my brother Johnny...
Off Ben's curdling smile, we DISSOLVE TO --

A helicopter shot through trees.  We soar over timberland and find something massive looming on the horizon: A SPACECRAFT.  A sleek take on a space shuttle.  Modern t combined with industrial design that NASA could never aff The craft's nose is pointed straight up, ready for launch WORKERS IN JUMPSUITS are scattered around the two-hundred foot tall scaffolding, performing routine checks.
Ben stares up at the craft.  A sneer on his face.
Can't do it.  I cannot do it.
External SRBs, orbital system engines.  Its just like the shuttles you flew in --
No.  I cannot take orders from that underwear model.  That wingnut washed out of NASA for sneaking two Victoria Secret wannabes into a flight  simulator.
Youthful high spirits.
They walk toward the base of the scaffolding.
They crashed it into a wall.  A flight simulator.
I'm sure he's matured since then.

CLOSE on JOHNNY STORM, leaning over to kiss a hot redhead PULL BACK TO REVEAL he's riding a MOTORCYCLE, and she's driving a red CORVETTE with license plate: FRANKIE.  PICK Reed and Ben, watching through binoculars.
When have I asked you to do something you absolutely said you could not do?
Five times.
I had it at four.
This makes five.
Reed and Ben unpack gear into lockers.  Suddenly --
Captain on the bridge!
Ben goes to attention on reflex: Johnny snaps a picture w a digital camera.  Then advances, as Ben realizes who it is...
Digital camera: $254.  Memory stick: $59.  The look on your hard-ass former CO's grill when he finds out he's your junior officer: priceless.
Ben eyeballs Johnny, suddenly reaches up as if to grab hi Johnny flinches.  But Ben just reaches for Johnny's zippe adjusts his uniform.
I can handle the ship.  I can even handle Mr. Blonde Ambition.  But I don't know if I should be flying or playing Vegas in these suits.  Who the hell came up with them?
Victor did.
Sue enters, wearing her blue, wetsuit-like uniform, carry a stack of flightsuits.  She hands them out to the guys.
The synthetics act as a second skin, adapting to your individual needs to --
Keep the hot side hot, and the cool side cool!
Wow.  Fantastic.
Reed stares at Sue in the skintight outfit.  She wonders, maybe hopes -- is he actually checking her out?
Material made from self-regulating unstable molecules.  I've been working on a formula for this.
Great minds think alike.
Guess some think faster than others.
Victor enters, wearing his custom-tailored flightsuit.
I hired Armani to design the pattern.  These colors will look great on camera.
A DOOR OPENS.  Leonard enters, in a sharp suit.
They're ready for you, sir.
Showtime.
Leonard leads Victor through the halls.  Victor checks himself in mirrors as he walks, fixing his hair, his unif
Our numbers are through the roof.  The IPO's tracking at fifty, sixty a share.  The bank's five times oversubscribed --
It's not just the money.  I could make money in my sleep.
Then what is it?
History, Leonard.  History.  Everything else is conversation... (a beat) How's the other matter?
Leonard pulls out a BOX.  Opens it: a TEN KARAT DIAMOND R
Harry Winston sends his regards.

They hit a set of big doors.  Victor stops and looks into reflective, metallic surface on the wall.  He fixes one l strand of hair.  Perfect. Then he opens the door to...  SNAP!SNAP!SNAP!  WHIP-PAN a row of CAMERAS snapping shots
Retrofitted into a makeshift press area.  Victor sits on platform, with reporters stretched out below him.
Today we stand on the edge of a new frontier.  In the furthest depths of outer space...we will find the secrets to inner space.  The final key to unlocking our genetic code lies in a cosmic storm...
BEHIND THE ACTION: Reed, Sue, Johnny and Ben walk past. crews barely notice, passing without even taking a pictur Our "Fantastic Four" are not exactly big news.  Not yet.
Isn't that your speech?
He's made a few changes.
This is your dream, Reed.  You should be the one up there.
Victor's better at these things.

Just past the press area, they see...one woman standing, waiting.  This is DEBBIE, Ben's fiancee.  And for the fir time in the entire film...Ben SMILES.  They hug, kissing. Johnny and Reed watch.  Reed glances at Sue, who walks ah Debbie slips a photo into Ben's flightsuit.  A tender bea
I'll be watching over you.
Just get back soon, or I start looking for a new groom.
Ben looks at the little ENGAGEMENT RING on her finger.
Soon as I'm back, I'm gonna trade that in for a bigger rock.
I don't care about rocks, I care about you. (to Reed) You bring him back in one piece, or you can forget being Best Man.
Reed nods, smiles.  Debbie gives Ben a last kiss.  Ben tu to Johnny, who gives a cocky smile.
What the hell you smiling at?  Just keep your mouth shut, and your mind on those SMBs --
Actually, the engines are SMEs. Hydrogenbase, carbon propellant.  Couple generations past your last ride. (at the threshold) I'm not as dumb as you look.
Ben just glares at Reed.  This is going to be a long trip As they follow after Sue, we CUT BACK TO --
Mid-speech.  Playing behind him is REED'S HOLOGRAM: stars give way to a pulsating red cloud...
Think of a world without genetic flaws -- no asthma, allergies, baldness, breast cancer...
Ben and Reed hear the speech.  Ben bristles.
What's wrong with being bald...?
Victor smiles at the crowd, commanding.  A true leader.
Darwin discovered evolution.  Now we -- I -- will define it.  Only in America could...
The red cloud of cosmic rays wash over the Earth.
...a little country boy from Latveria build one of the biggest companies in the world, and truly reach the stars.  Now if you'll excuse me, history awaits...

On those words, the HOLOGRAM TRANSFORMS TO...Von Doom's SHUTTLE on the launch pad.  BOOM!  THRUSTERS FIRE WHITE H Smoke billows across the pad.  Ready for take off. Victor walks past the hologram and exits.  His departure perfectly timed with the shuttle LIFTING OFF. We push in on the shuttle, and follow the ship as it leav Earth's atmosphere.  BOOM -- booster rockets fall away an the shuttle fires its thrusters.  The hologram transition to... A shot of the SPACE STATION high above the Earth.  The shuttle enters from the top, lighting up the hologram wit engines afire.  As the shuttle approaches the station we
THE SPACE STATION in the distance, rotating in orbit abov Earth.  THE SHUTTLE eases in and docks.
Victor and Sue lead the others into the command center.
(a "dad voice": to Ben) If you behave, maybe next time daddy'll let you drive.
Keep talking, there won't be a next time.
Reed is focused on THE EARTH.
Long way from the projection booth at the Hayden Planetarium, isn't it?
Reed turns towards her -- a little stunned that she would bring that up.  It's the first time she's been nice to hi far.  He smiles, gently, hesitantly, always hesitant with Sue.
Yes.  Yes it is.
Johnny and Ben exchange a look.  Reed keeps looking at th stars, eyes wide, like a little kid.
They enter the nerve center of the space station.  Victor goes to a computer console on the observation deck below. The windows are closed, so there's nothing to observe.
(to ground; via comm-link) Leonard, how's the feed?
Recording, sir.  We see you perfectly.
Victor glances at a camera mounted into the console.
We can monitor the cloud's approach and observe the tests from here.
Is it safe?
The shields on the station should protect us.
Should?
What's wrong, Ben?  Eighty-million dollars worth of equipment not enough for you?
Ben turns to Victor.  A little tension.  Reed cuts it:
Let's start loading those samples.  Get your suit ready, Ben.
Victor keeps his eyes on Ben.
So you still do all the heavy lifting?
Victor gives a friendly smile, patting Reed.
Maybe you should have stayed back in the lab.  Field work never suited you.
Reed doesn't defend himself.  Ben steps up.
He does the talking.  I do the walking.  Got it?
Victor holds tight to his smile.  He nods, condescending.
Got it.  So take a walk, Ben...I'm going to borrow Susan for a second.
Sure.
Ben and Johnny read his eyes, as we CUT TO --
Ben preps for a space walk, putting on a helmet and boots Johnny unloads a set of clear sample boxes off of a cart, each containing a variety of plants.
Please tell me your dawg's not trying to rekindle things with my sister.
'Course not.  Strictly business.
Yeah, well, his eyes say different.
Hey, two hearts got busted last time.  Maybe she's not over it either.
Let's see: you got Victor, stud of the year, more coin than God?  Or Reed, the world's dumbest smart guy worth less than a postage stamp.  Hmmm, it's a toss-up.
Put your tiny little mind at ease.
Don't you wander off, boy.
Johnny steps out of the air-lock and shuts the door.  He looks through a small window to see Ben give the thumbs u THE AIRLOCK DOOR opens, and Ben gracefully steps into spa
Sue descends the stairs at Victor's behest.  Joins him.
Surprised I agreed to Reed's proposal?
I understand the business reasons.
Well, when you're looking at your future, it never hurts to find closure about the past.
Sue's eyes narrow.  What is this about...?
Susan, every man dreams that he'll meet some woman he can give the world to.
He presses a button and the observation deck's outer wind open up, revealing a spectacular, romantic view of the EA
In my case, it's not just a metaphor.
While she stares out the window, Victor reaches into a pocket, revealing a RING BOX.  Sue looks unsettled.

Reed checks data on a work station, set on a wall.  The results of his calculations are not what he expected... H sees WIND VELOCITY digits rise.  He does a double-take wh he sees the readout: EVENT THRESHOLD, T-MINUS 10:00.
No...no...impossible.  It's...too fast.
Behind his back, Victor holds the ring box in hand.
You've been with me two years now.
Sue doesn't know where this is going.  She treads lightly
It's been a good two years, Victor... The company's accomplished so much.
Right, of course, the company... But you see, I've come to realize all the accomplishments in the world mean nothing without someone to share them with --
Uh, Victor, I hope I haven't done something to make you think...

Sue, I've lived my life unafraid of taking big steps.  And this is the biggest step yet.  If it helps, think of this as a promotion.  A merger of sorts... (getting closer) Four little words that can change our lives...
He is about to spring the ring on her.  She looks like a in headlights.  She opens her mouth, and...WHAM!  Doors s open.  REED RUSHES INTO THE ROOM.
The cloud is accelerating!
Victor quickly puts the ring back in his pocket.
I don't know what happened.
Sue quickly moves to a nearby control panel to verify Ree claim.  Starts punching buttons.  Confirms Reed's finding with a nod.  Victor hardens, in control.
We've got minutes until it hits, not hours...Victor, that storm's deadly -- the radiation's lethal.  We need to abort.
Get a grip.  Reed.  We didn't come all this way to lose our nerve at the first little glitch.  Just close the shields...
Ben's still out there --
So reel him in.  But we came here to do a job.  So let's do it.  Quickly.
Ben is carefully arranging SAMPLE BOXES OF PLANTS.
Ben, we need you back inside.
Ben turns to see Reed and Johnny staring from a window.
I ain't done arranging your flowers, egghead.
Ben.  This is serious.  Turn around.
Ben sees Johnny motioning for Ben to look behind him.  Be turns and sees: THE COSMIC STORM, rumbling toward the station.  Not close, but not far.  That gets Ben's attent
Roger that, on my way.
He turns back towards the ship.  BEHIND HIM, the storm gr
Victor rushes into the room, looks at the monitors.  Sees others near the airlock on one screen, and the approachin cloud on another.  Anxiety creeps across his face.
Event threshold in two minutes.
Reed and Johnny stand by the airlock, waiting for Ben.  T heard the automated voice.  It panics Reed.
Come on, Ben, come on...
Reed, we're running out of time.
A wake of turbulence from the cloud hits Ben, making it harder to maneuver.  The cloud's tendrils snake toward hi
They can see Ben outside the window, still twenty yards a The entire corridor rumbles.  Lights flicker and spark. watch helplessly.
Sue watches the monitor, also helpless.
Johnny... Reed...
Victor, annoyed by the indecisiveness, marches right up t Sue.  Practically shoves her aside as he hits the INTERCO
Reed, you need to get up here so we can close the shields!  Now!
Sue glares at Victor.  His lack of compassion shocks her.
Not until Ben is back inside!
It's too late for him, and soon it'll be too late for all of us.
Victor doesn't bother to wait for a response.  He takes o the console, punching keys.
What are you doing?
Raising the shields.
You can't leave them out there.
Sue glares with as much contempt as her face can muster.
Watch me.  Reed had his chance.  You can't help them any more than I can.
Beat.  She takes a step toward the door.  Not sure what t do.
I can try.
With one final glare, she bolts from the room.
Reed bites his lip.  Thinks.  He decides.
Victor's right.  Johnny, get to the command center.  Close the shields.
What about you?
One look from Reed tells Johnny, he won't leave without B Johnny eyes Ben, steels his courage.  He's not going eith
(to Ben) Come on big guy, you can do it!
Victor watches the shields slide down.  Alone.  An island
Event threshold in thirty seconds.
Sue races down the hall.  Not panicked.  With determinati

The exterior air lock door slides open.  In agonizing, weightless slow motion Ben reaches to haul himself inside The leading edge of the cloud hits: Ben is pelted by a hissing mass of space dust, splattering his suit with ora stains.  Larger particles, small pellets, pepper him.  Be hauls himself in the last few feet by pulling on his teth
Event threshold in ten seconds.  TEN...
Johnny punches controls to close the exterior airlock doo Reed opens a first aid kit, grabs a thermo-elastic blanke

Clutching the diamond ring, Victor stands defiantly.  Sho absolutely no concern for the others.  Interested only in event itself.  Lights and equipment FALL, CRASHING around him. A control panel EXPLODES in Victor's face.  He jumps back and into the falling equipment.  Collapses under the weig
Sue rounds a corner, sees Reed and Johnny.
Johnny!  Reed!
FIVE...FOOOOUUUR...

SLOW MOTION: Everyone frozen in position as: -- JOHNNY is hit with sparks of flame from a control pane -- REED REACHES out for Ben and the airlock door. -- VAPOR STREAM pours down on Sue from a blown gasket. -- THE SPACE DUST burns into Ben's skin. SLOW MOTION: Just BEFORE the exterior air-lock door close SINGLE PARTICLE zips through the narrowing gap and hits B in the back, ripping through his suit.  The exterior door shuts and seals.  The station loses all power.  DARKNESS.

As quickly as it came, the cloud passes on and whirls awa leaving the space station intact.  Power quietly flickers Silence.  Time resumes.  All four pick up exactly where t left off, unaware of anything that just happened to them.
Victor emerges from the rubble.  He stands, checks his bo A few scrapes, nothing serious.  A thin, throbbing CUT on head.  He touches the wound, but it is not bleeding.
Reed and Johnny scramble to open the interior air lock do Sue joins them, as they pull Ben in.  They try to remove helmet.  We don't see his face, but he's clearly unconsci
He's not responsive --
Ben!  Ben!
Ben, wake up!  Wake up!
SUBJECTIVE CAMERA, BEN'S POV: The blurry image of Johnny comes slowly into focus, standing beside a hospital bed.
Where...where am I?
Back on Earth.  Victor's medical facility... We're in quarantine.
Reed? ... Sue?
They're fine.  Everybody else...is fine.
Johnny looks away, as if he can't bear to lay eyes on him
What's wrong with me?
I swear to you they've done everything humanly possible.  The best plastic surgeons in the world, Ben.  You had the best --
Give me a mirror...
Johnny picks up a hand mirror on the bed table before Ben reach it, reluctant to give it to him.
They said that's not such a good idea, the shock alone could --
Give me the god damn mirror!
Ben grabs it from him.  Then slowly raises it to look and that...except for some serious stubble, Ben's totally nor
Unfortunately, the doctors just couldn't do anything to fix your face!
He cackles as he heads for the door.  Ben heaves the mirr at him, breaking it into hundreds of pieces.  He turns to side-table, and grabs that picture of DEBBIE.  It calms h
A modern facility of glass and stone, nestled in the fore In stark contrast to the lush greenery surrounding it.

text: Reed walks down the hall.  His hair is GRAYING at the temples.  He passes Johnny, who is smiling, still enjoyin his joke on Ben.  Johnny slows, looking at Reed's hair.
Nice 'do.  Going for the "grandpa" look?

Reed passes a mirror, slowing, seeing his gray hairs.  He keeps going.  He passes a partially open door.  He stops he catches a glimpse of Sue asleep in bed.  He sees a vas flowers.  He grabs a couple lilies, and enters. But Reed sees...the room is already FILLED with expensive flowers.  All from VICTOR.  Reed is trumped once again. A DOCTOR writes on Sue's chart.  A wall TV plays a press conference with Victor, outside the FACILITY.  He looks w for wear.  A few hairs out of place, and a small BANDAGE his face.  We PUSH INTO the press conference --
You've been accused in the past of moving science a little too fast --
Accused by who?  My competitors?
But surely this accident gives you pause --
Danger is always part of discovery.  What would have happened if Ben Franklin never went out in a storm? Without risk, there's no reward.
So where's the reward?  You promised a cure-all.
Victor pauses.  For the first time.  Just a flicker.
And you'll have it.  I've never come up short.  And I'm not going to start now.
So you're still taking VDI public --
Yes, of course.  I've never been more confident in the compan--
Reed mutes the television.
How's she doing?
Stable.  Vitals are strong.
Reed takes the clipboard, looks for himself.
Blood panels show no irradiation.  Good.  You'll step up this protocol, every --
Four hours.  We know what we're doing... One more day of observation, then you're all cleared.
The Doctor takes his clipboard, and walks out.  Reed step Sue, with the drooping flowers in his hand.  Quiet:
Sue...I want to tell you...I'm...
WHOOSH.  A NURSE rolls in with a tray bearing ten more extravagant bouquets.  Reed looks resigned.  He walks out
She's allergic to orchids.  Put that Amaryllis Apapathos by her bed.  The African lilies?  They're her favorites.
Reed exits, dropping his two wilted lilies into the trash Sue opens one eye, as the big lilies land by the bed.
A SEXY NURSE wheels a testing station into Johnny's room. He's stripped down to Calvins, changing into a ski outfit
And where do we think we're going?
I don't know if "we've" noticed, but the sickest runs this side of the Alps are right outside that window --
I've noticed... But doctor's orders, you're not allowed to leave until we --
Finish the tests, I know -- could you give me a hand with this zipper?
You know this is not a ski resort.
Not yet.
Johnny opens the cardboard box, revealing a colorful fiberglass object the size of a briefcase.  In the blink an eye, he unfolds it into a LONG SNOWBOARD.
Luckily grandma still sends care packages.
The nurse pops a thermometer in his mouth to shut him up.
You are trouble.
(thermometer in his mouth) Brubbles my Triddle Name.
They both pay more attention to his zipper than the digit read-out: it runs right up past 98.6, then accelerates fa
You're hot!
So are you!
I mean, you feel a little feverish.
I've never felt better in my life.  When do you get off work?
My shift ends at four, but I couldn't --
Meet me at 4:01, top of the run.  That'll give you a minute to freshen up.
He hands her the thermometer, a quick kiss and he's out t door.  The machine beeps: Johnny's temperature is 209 DEGREES.
Ben finds Reed on a patio with a panoramic view.  Reed wo at a laptop computer.
How long was I out?
Three days.  I was worried about you.  How are you feeling?
Solid.
Ben can see Reed doesn't look too solid.
How you doing?
Reed shakes his head, looking back at his screen.
I don't know.  I just keep going over and over the numbers.
Reed.  Even you can't compute every little thing.
I should have done more, run more tests --
Ben gets closer, pushing down Reed's computer screen.
It was a freak of nature.  Last I checked, you don't have a crystal ball.  Let it go.
Reed considers.  But he can't let it go.  He opens his computer back up, returning to work.  Ben shakes his head looks out at the view.  His eyes catch on something, whee turning.
You go through something like this, makes you appreciate having the right woman in your life.
Yeah, you and Debbie and perfect --
Reed, I'm not talking about Debbie.
Reed follows Ben's eyes to a lower level patio: SUE.
What?  Come on.  She's got a good thing with Victor --
I'm sorry, did that cosmic-bath loosen your screws?
He's smart, powerful, successful --
Well maybe you should date him.
Reed looks at Ben, resigned.
Ben.  He'll give her the life she deserves.  She ended up with the right guy.  Things worked out for the best.

Do I have to do everything myself?

Passion.

He motions to her body.  She understands.  She concentrat and starts to turn invisible.

She unbuttons her blouse.  Not thrilled with the idea.  S wriggles out of her pants.  Down to her skivvies.  She reaches back to undo her bra...momentarily loses concentration and becomes visible.  The sight of Sue in h undies grabs the COPS' attention.  Everyone watches, stun The realization that she's visible hits her like a ton of bricks.  Cops are transfixed.  So is Reed.

Ben.  Are you okay?
Am I okay?!  You wanna explain that?!
He motions to Reed's neck.  Then to his own body:

REED!  BEN!  LOOK OUT!

The flames are mushroomin Reed SWIPES his ARMS OUT, holding people back.  His arms FLATTEN to form a barricade -- FACES INDENT his skin. FLAMES lash out.  A pack of attractive YOUNG WOMEN scream Johnny LEAPS toward them.  His feet LEAVE THE GROUND, giv him extra lift.  He SPINS, lands, and embraces the women, SHIELDING them from flames which burn up his back.  He lo the ladies up and down, and gives a cheesy smile. Sue SCREAMS. WHOOSH! leaves a flaming imprint on the all-beef patty. The crowd stands stunned.  So do Reed and Sue.  Cameras p Johnny slowly pulls himself up. He and Ben lock eyes, with a block of sidewalk between th High Noon.  They start to RUN toward each other... When they are almost within range, Sue STEPS BETWEEN THEM stops them both in their tracks with just a look.  Like a mom:

Together?  Look at me, Susie.  You got no idea what I'd give...to be invisible.  Your nightmare...is my dream.

He motions to his men.  They all stand.  Victor is the lo man sitting.  PUSH IN on Victor's face, his inner rage palpable.  A few quick surges of electricity emanate from body.  This man is getting stronger, more electric.

After hours.  The floor is slick with water -- puddles in every direction.  Ned Cecil comes out of the elevator, heading for his car.  As he goes, the structure lights st to flicker.  Ned looks up, watches the lights go out one one, furthest to closest.  He looks around.  Unnerved by darkness.
Hello...?

(relieved, almost) Von Doom?  Gave me a little shock.  No hard feelings, right?  Nothing personal.

She gets closer, running her hands across his arm.

I mean...

As he ponders that, we hear a CROWD SWELLING on the CUT T

Someone SHUSHES them.  They slump down further.  Closer.

Their eyes lock.  A heated beat.  No more secrets.  Their faces are close.  A kiss is coming.  Closer, closer.  Sue disappears.
(quiet, playful) Come find me.

I'm worried about you.
About me?  How sweet.
Come on.  Let me buy you something to eat.  Looks like you could use the company.

The Thing shoves a huge piece of pie in his mouth.
Reed's gonna fix me up --

Skeptical...?

At least it beats living in a lab like somebody's science project.
This hits home.  Sue is quiet.  Johnny turns to go.
Johnny, slow down.  Think.  You know mom didn't raise us to --
Look around, sis!  She's not here.  So you can stop talking to me like I'm your little boy --
As soon as you stop acting like one.  Come on, you're smarter than this.  You think those people out there care about you?  You're just a fad to them.
He pulls away from her, taking a step out the door.
Let's try something new: you live your life.  And I'll live mine. (beat) And just for the record: they LOVE me.
He strides into the night, leaving Sue alone.  A dark nig The Fantastic Four is no more.  The family is split apart
The transformation chamber is up and running.  Numbers co down.  The storm swirls in the chamber.  Reed now wears t UNIFORM.  He opens the door:

text: Victor sits enthralled.  He leans forward, breathless.

Reed gets closer.  His heart races.  So does Victor's.  A moment of truth for both of them.  REED STEPS INTO THE MACHINE. Reed looks up at the cosmic storm.  He opens his arms, re to risk his life.  And...WHHHM!  He JOLTS in JUMP-CUT-MOT RECONFIGURING, JERKING out of control, and we CUT TO --
His screens GO BLACK.  He looks out the window to see...a flash atop the BAXTER BUILDING.  The tip of the Baxter gl The rest of its lights GO OUT, FLICKERING in a power surg
Lights go haywire.  Sue knows immediately...
Oh god, Reed.

Lights flicker in darkness.  The door rips open.  Sue lun inside.  She sees through smoke and sparks...REED sways i the chamber.  A beat.  Did it work?  Then... Reed SLUMPS TO THE GROUND.  His eyes flutter back.  Dead. His body is warped, twisted -- one half remains tense, ha while the other half is loose, soft, almost melted.
What did you do, Reed?  What did you do?
Victor watches every second on his monitors.
Sue struggles to lift Reed -- half of his body is STRETCH OUT, devoid of any semblance of bone structure.  One side his face looks like it's MELTING OFF.
I can...make it work.
Reed, stop, you need to rest your --
The power...I need...more power...to control...the storm --
You need a doctor.
Reed loses consciousness.  Sue carries him out.
Victor watches, his eyes narrow, looking at his hands.
More power...?
He reaches out for his phone, and...his SPEAKERPHONE AUTOMATICALLY TURNS ON.  His powers growing.
Leonard.  Bring me our lab rat.
Ben sits alone, looking at city lights.  A man without a home.  Without a family.  A hard beat.  HEADLIGHTS slash across Ben.  He slowly turns, blinded in the lights of... LIMO.
Ben!  They need you back at the Baxter building.  It's...Reed.
Ben considers.  Despite it all, he's a good friend.  And good man.  As he gets into the car, we hear THROBBING MUS

LOUD MUSIC and PULSATING LIGHTS.  A young crowd dances an grinds to the beat.  Among the colorful lights, STREAKS O FLAME swirl around the ceiling.  We follow them to: A BALCONY, where we see JOHNNY sitting in a cozy VIP sect He's surrounded by "groupies" climbing over each other to a look at his various parlour tricks. He leans closer to a YOUNG WOMAN.  Closer.  Candles aroun them start to melt.  Beads of sweat drip down her face.
What do you say we get out of here?
She pauses.  And...a very LARGE MAN steps up.
This your boyfriend?
The Boyfriend doesn't look too happy.
Is that all you do?  Bar tricks and stealing chicks...

Johnny does one more trick...taps the guy's drink...ignit it into a burst of flame.  The Boyfriend drops the glass, which SMASHES on the ground...catches the floor on fire. The boyfriend quickly moves in and stamps it out.
What are you doing?!  You could have burned somebody!
The boyfriend takes his girlfriend's hand, they start to off.  She turns back for one last comment...
You know, if I had your power I'd be doing something with it, not wasting my time doing cheap bar tricks, hitting on some other guy's girl.
Johnny looks a little embarrassed.  The couple leaves.  Johnny glances around.  His FANS look down, away.  He see how quickly they can turn.  The crowd parts slightly.  He looks very alone.
Leonard leads The Thing inside.  The ominous chamber sits with its door open.  Victor enters from the control stati
Ben, come in.
What is this?  Where's Reed?
Where do you think?  With Sue.
Ben looks at the flickering lights.  Suspicious.  Victor turns to Leonard, who looks a little scared by this dark room.
(quiet) I'll take it from here, Leonard.
Leonard nods, all too eager to get the hell out of here.
Yes sir.
Leonard disappears fast, as Victor turns back to Ben.
What do you want, Vic?
To help you.  I've run every test known to man.  And they all yield the same result: the machine is ready.
Ben shakes his head, wanting to believe, but...
Reed said it'd be weeks till --
He also said we'd avoid that storm in space.  And we know how that turned out.
Ben nods.  Reed was wrong before.  Ben gets closer to the machine, drawn to it.  He wants to believe, so badly.
He couldn't generate enough power for the machine to reach critical mass.  Yet another mistake for "Mr. Fantastic."
And you can?  Power it up?
Victor stands in shadows, but we see the tiniest little S around him.  The lights...?  Or his skin...?
Yes.  I've found a new energy source.
He keeps his arm behind his back -- his fingertips course with ELECTRICITY.  It starts to build, sparking up his ar
Tell me...do you want to be Ben Grimm again?
Ben keeps his eyes on the machine.  His dream is alive.
Let's do it.

The chamber doors open.  Thing enters.  He looks around t sterile box.  An animal in a cage.  Victor pushes a contr the doors of the chamber slowly close and seal.  Thing sh his eyes.  He just wants to be Ben again. FROM THE CONTROLS: Victor initiates the transformation sequence.  As lights go on inside the chamber, they dim i the lab.  Energy pumps into the chamber.  The storm swirl faster.  Lights flicker...there's not enough power, until -- Victor walks over...grabs hold of the machine with bot hands...and WHHHM!  A countdown begins in the control pan SLOW MOVE IN on the chamber, The Thing's face in the wind The chamber activates.  The storm strikes hard. The Thing opens his mouth, a beat, then he screams in ago Struggling violently inside.  To escape?  Extend the mome Condensation obscures the chamber window: The Thing vanis
The city lights fill the sky, and give it a quiet, eerie glow.  Suddenly, a BRIGHT FLASH emerges from the window o the Baxter Building.  The rest of the city lights dim slightly.

Reed lies in bed, weak, recuperating.  When the power sur we MOVE in on him: he looks up in alarm, knowing that someone's using the chamber.  He starts to get out of bed straining to stand with every muscle left in his body.
Sue sifts through a cabinet full of medications.  The lig dim.  Power failure.  She looks up...
Johnny walks alone.  A WAVE OF LIGHT spreads through the He looks up.  His eyes adjust to the blast, as he realize where it's coming from.  He starts RUNNING toward the Bax

INSIDE THE MACHINE, the RED CLOUD swirls with debris, crackling with light.  The chamber rattles dangerously, a the power seems to SHAKE the very foundation of the build And then it's over.  The light dies down...somewhat.  It still pulses along with the chamber.  The chamber door SL OPEN. Beat.  And...BEN GRIMM steps out.  Not The Thing.  No mor rocks.  BEN GRIMM.  Naked, tired, but finally A NORMAL MA He slips on his trench-coat -- now way too large.  He collapses.  He stares at his hands, his arms...it worked.
Oh my God... Th-thank you.  THANK YOU...VIC?!

Ben sees a SPARK in shadows.  That spark is... VICTOR'S ARM.  Victor steps forward, and reveals himself Ben: ELECTRICITY PUMPS THROUGH HIS BODY.  His skin is par flesh, part metal.  Cheekbone exposed, steel tissue. HE IS DOOM.
Vic... What the...?
Everyone thought I was safe behind those shields...
Victor, the machine worked for me.  It can work for you --
It did, Ben.  It worked perfectly.
Ben starts to realize...
You planned this...?
Doom smiles, reaches out his hand -- ELECTRICITY builds f his shoulders, coursing down his arms to his fingertips.
I've always wanted power.  Now I've got an unlimited supply...
And no Thing to stand in your way.
DOOM smiles, nods, stronger than Ben now.
Take a good look, Ben.  This is what a man looks like who embraces his destiny.
Doom clenches his fist and BLASTS Ben, sending him flying backwards across the room -- knocked unconscious.
One down, three to go.
Suddenly, WHOOSH!  The lab door flies open.  Reed enters. Doom steps back into the shadows.
Right on cue.
Reed's eyes go wide.  He sees Ben crumpled in the corner.
Oh god Ben.  Are you okay? (amazed) You did it, you really did it...
No, Reed.  I did.
Reed slowly turns to see...DOOM.  His body, his face.
Victor...?  What, what happened to you?  What did you do to your --
Exactly what I said I would: I built a better, stronger being.  And outsmarted the great Reed Richards --
Victor, this isn't the way to --
(a dark smile) You always know best.  So tell me.  What happens when you superheat rubber?
Doom BLASTS an electrical BOLT at Reed, KNOCKING Reed thr the huge window!  Reed's body RUBBER-BANDS from the blast
Reed SLINKIES down the face of the building, skin ripplin
Doom looks out the window, smiling at his old friend's fa
DING!  The elevator opens.  Doom strides out.  He passes friend O'HOOLIHAN, who looks scared.
Mr. Von Doom?  Are you oka--
Doom casually SWIPES, sending him through revolving doors
Never better, Jimmy.  And it's Doctor Doom now.

Reed MELTS down the sides of an AWNING, like a Salvador D watch.  He tries to GRAB HOLD of window ledges, but he ca get a grip.  His ARM streeetches, and SNAP!  He falls lik SLINKY, out of control.  Half his body loose, half hard. He drips to the sidewalk, where...Doom steps out.  He cat Reed's face, holds it close.
Why the long face?

Doom whips Reed into the night.  As Doom turns, people co horrified by his face.  They clear out, and... Doom sees his REFLECTION in a window: scarred skin, metal veins.  A monster.  Infuriated, he SHATTERS the window wi an iron fist, and bounds into the night.
Smoke billows, windows are shattered.  Sue races inside, seeing Doom's devastation.  Silence, deadly silence.  Then...she sees a pile of WRECKAGE shift.  BEN crawls out
Ben?!
She helps him out of the rubble.  He is beaten, battered.
Sue!
Johnny comes running in.  He sees the wreckage.
I'm sorry, sis, for leaving you guys --
No, I'm sorry, for pushing you out.
He nods.  A beat between them.  He looks around, sees Ben
Jesus, Ben! (eyeing him) I go away, look what happens.  You got a lot of explaining to do.
He motions to the wreckage.
(struggling, weak) The machine works.  And Vic's gone Mister Hyde on us --
Really?  With a name like Von Doom?  Never saw that one coming.
Sue looks around.  Only one question.  Dead serious:
Where is Reed?
Victor must've taken him.

Doom sits at the head of the table in an eerie parallel t the opening scene.  Those mysterious CRATES loom in shado He wears a green HOOD, and METAL MASK over his scarred fa Doom's eyes turn toward...the other end of the table.
Chemistry 101, Part Two.  What happens to rubber when it's super- cooled?

We now see what he sees: Reed sits in a chair with TUBES INJECTED into his skin FREEZING HIM SOLID!  Ultra-cold va coats him.  Doom steps closer, a sadistic smile. Reed tries to move but can't even ball his hand into a fi
Allow me.
He PRESSES DOWN on one of Reed's fingers, which makes a horrific CRACKING SOUND.  Reed's face twists with pain.
Painful...?
Doom seems to enjoy every CRACK.  He leans closer.
You don't know the meaning of the word.
Doom lets up on Reed and reaches into a crate, and pulls a military-issue ROCKET-LAUNCHER.  He aims at the city skyline, locking onto his target: JOHNNY STORM.
But you will.
Johnny's HEAT SIGNATURE glows.  The screen flashes: TARGE ACQUIRED.  Doom looks back at Reed, his launcher aimed casually over his shoulder.
Flame off.
BOOOOM!  He fires without looking!  A MISSILE blasts into sky.  THE MISSILE LIGHTS UP THE DARK NIGHT beginning its turn towards its target.
Johnny, Ben, and Sue hear the missile being fired and tur the window -- it BANKS, coming STRAIGHT for them.  They m to --

Johnny rushes toward the edge, to get a good look at the missile streaking closer.  As he moves, the missile SHIFT slightly with HIS MOTION!  His eyes narrow, thinking. He FLAMES ON a HAND.  He waves his flaming hand, and the MISSILE locks onto the fire!  Johnny darkens, realizing..
Great.  Heat-seeker.
His mind races.  He makes a decision, and steps up onto t ledge, hundreds of feet above the street.
What are you doing --
Sis.  Let me take care of you for once.
But Johnny...you can't fly.
Johnny considers, a half-beat.  He looks out.  Under brea
Well then this'll be one hell of a basejump.
Sue reaches out to stop him, but Johnny DIVES HEROICALLY THE EDGE!  He FLAMES ON!  The missile follows his arc.  A drops, his clothes BURN OFF, revealing his UNIFORM.
(under breath) Come on...come on...come on...
He falls lower, lower.  And...he...BANKS!  SWOOPS UP!
FLAME ON.
Sue watches, with fear, and a hint of pride.
We need to help Reed --
Sue shakes her head, sympathetic.
Ben, you got what we all wanted.  You need to stay here.  It's too dangerous.
She heads off.  Ben watches her go, helpless.
Ben steps back into this ravaged room.  Through the shatt window, he sees Johnny's FLAMES streaking away.  A hard b
What...what have I done?
Johnny zigs and zags, but the missile takes every twist a turn, gaining on him, bearing down.  Cars slow, stop.  Mo people look up, scared, pointing at this stunning sight.

Eerily silent.  Reed tries to move, but he is FROZEN.  He hears a footstep.  But the room is EMPTY.  No sign of Doo even.  A beat.  He hears a CREAK.  Another CREAK, closer. And... A FREEZING TUBE starts to SHIFT.  It goes taut, clearly b manipulated by a hand -- an INVISIBLE HAND.  Sue APPEARS to Reed, tube in hand.  She tries to stay calm.
What has he done to you?
Reed's eyes shift to see...Doom emerge from the darkness.
How romantic.
Victor, please --
It's Doctor Doom to you.
He steps closer.  Electrodes course over his metal skin.
We know the machine works.  It worked on Ben, it'll work on you.  We can turn you back --
Do you really think fate turned us into gods so we could refuse these gifts?
She hardens, a little force field starts to emanate from
Victor.  You always thought you were god.
Doom has a hand behind his back, generating an energy bla
Sue please, let's not fight.
No, Victor... Let's.
She HURLS a force-field at him.  It CONNECTS, KNOCKING hi back a half-step.  But he simply shakes it off, and steps Too powerful.  He smiles.  His arms CRACKLE with electric
Susan...... You're fired.
BOOM!  He FIRES an ELECTRIC SHOCKWAVE that LAUNCHES her b She spirals through the air, crashing into the wall, THUD to the floor.  As Doom stalks closer, Sue gathers her strength to...GO INVISIBLE.
Marco...
A hanging beat.  We see: a FAINT OUTLINE of Sue behind hi
Polo.

He SPINS, GRABS her!  Doom grips her neck, SLAMMING her t the ground beside Reed.  She lays there, beaten, visible. In the distance behind Doom, city lights BLINK, fading in out.  Lights flutter softly here (like when Ben went thro the machine).  Reed looks up.  Could it be...?

Johnny jets over the water with the missile only twenty f behind him.  He's running out of options, when he spots: A GARBAGE BARGE floating in the water ahead.  Thinking fa Johnny does a fly-by and HURLS a fireball at the barge.  VWOOSH!  The flames ignite and spread quickly. He loops back toward the flaming barge as the missile clo in on him.  Fifteen feet...ten... Just as it's about to h JOHNNY FLAMES OFF and falls toward the water.  As he tumb through the air, we CUT BACK TO --

From their vantage point, they see the missile explode.  Flames dance. Sue's eyes darken, as Doom grips her neck. Reed tries desperately to move, but he is FROZEN.  It tak every last ounce of strength to lift one finger, which ma a CRACCCKKKKING sound.
One more down.  Now it's just the scientist and his specimen.
Sue and Reed lock eyes.  Reed tries to move his mouth.  H has something to tell her, struggling just to move his li and get the words out.
Sue.  The only thing I ever knew without thinking was... (his lips fully freezing) I...love...
He starts to say "you," but his lips FREEZE, mid-word.  S whispers to him:
Me too, Reed.
Doom steps toward Sue, about to deliver the final blow.
(quiet, cruel) And so four became none.  It's my time now.
BOOOOM!  An elevator DOOR FLIES INTO THE ROOM!  SMASH!
Actually, Vic...
Reed recognizes the voice.  So do we.  Doom turns to see. BEN GRIMM, AKA THE THING.  Back in rocky, fighting form.
IT'S CLOBBERING TIME!

Doom turns, just as -- BAM!  Ben HITS Doom harder than any living thing has ever been hit.  The force sends Doom back through the air, tow the far wall, where he SMASHES into the massive "V" sculpture.  It SNAPS, crashing onto him.  A few sparks. nothing. Nothing at all.  No more movement.  Doom is dead. Ben turns to Reed.
Damn, I've been wanting to do that.
Reed manages the thinnest smile as Ben starts disconnecti the tubes from Reed.
(Reed's words) Victor's "not that bad," huh?  Just "a little larger than life"?  Maybe you'll listen to me next time before --
WHMM!  The WRECKAGE shifts.  They turn to see...Doom EMER He stands, power coursing.  And he CHARGES at Ben!  Ben charges back.  And these two behemoths...

Doom steps out of the garbage truck, wat flooding the street around him.  COP CARS converge on Doo Doom turns his attention to the cops.  His limbs SPARK wi electricity, ready to fire at the cars.

Excuse me, Maam.  Can I borrow your car?

The clutch sticks a little.
Not gonna be a problem.

Doom grabs the broken ELECTRICIT POLE, FLIPS it into his hand, and wields the pole like a giant STUN-GUN!  Electric sparks FLY through the air into BEN!  The BLAST of VOLTS launches him off his feet!  He g FLYING backward, ELECTROCUTED in mid-flight, and -- WHOOMPF!  Ben LANDS HARD, face down, CRATERING the street Water rushes into the crater.  Ben lays there, incapacita
On the street, cars SCREAM to stops, people GASP.  Doom strides up to Ben, and raises the ELECTRICITY POLE for th death-blow.  Currents surge.  Right before he swings down
I can't let you do that.
Simple, strong.  Doom turns to see...REED.  Alone.  Bruis and battered.  Slowly stepping toward him.  Doom smiles.
And you can't stop me.
He turns back to Ben, raises the pole, but...he CAN'T SWI DOWN!  Something is HOLDING the pole in mid-air. Something invisible.
Hello Susan.

She turns VISIBLE, holding back the pole with a FORCEFIEL Using her power, she FLINGS the pole from Doom's grip.  I skids along the street.  Reed helps Ben to his feet. Doom turns to these three wounded soldiers.
What is this?  The pitiful three?
Doom steps toward them, but --
Four.
WHOOOSH!  Johnny SWOOPS DOWN, hurling a FIREBALL like a flamethrower, KNOCKING Doom back. Johnny takes his place alongside the others.  The four of them stand as one.  Johnny turns to Thing.
Had a little relapse, huh?
Thing starts to retort, but Johnny gives a warm smile.
Welcome back.
They turn to Doom, who stands with metal skin slightly si and melted, making him look all the more menacing.
This is going to be fun.

Electricity starts to course through his body.  He stands the foot of the crater Ben made.  He THRUSTS down, grabbi thick POWER CABLE, RIPPING it out of the street! He SNAPS the cable into two snaking, lashing strips.  He holds tight, ABSORBING the power.  Lights FLICKER and DIM buildings around him.  Windows BLOW!  Doom GLOWS, amped u He LETS GO of the cables!  The two deadly wires SNAKE out control!  PEDESTRIANS scatter, panic.  Reed sees the wire SLASHING through the air.  He makes a move: Reed STREEETCHES HIS ARMS, reaching for the deadly cables Doom FIRES superpowered ENERGY BOLTS.  The electric charg surge through the air toward the Fantastic Four, but -- Sue TOSSES her FORCE-FIELDS, exploding Doom's blasts in m flight.  She keeps her hands up, BLOCKING blows like a pr fighter.  One of Doom's BOLTS glances off her force-field and -- SMASHES into a concrete stanchion of a BUILDING!  The pil starts to crumble, with PEOPLE huddled under the overhang They're about to be CRUSHED by the falling concrete!  But Suddenly, the concrete roof HOLDS STEADY...because...BEN holding it up!  He stands beside the stanchion, like Atla holding the world.  People run out, safe. ON THE STREET: Reed finally grabs both ends of the wire.
JOHNNY!  SPOT-WELD!

Johnny FLIES toward him, and uses his flames to WELD the wires back together.  Sparks fly.  The cables start to FU Doom keeps FIRING.  Sue struggles with her force-fields. impact is too much.  Her nose starts to bleed.
Can't...hold...on...

Doom smiles.  Reed sees her.  She is about to drop her ha vulnerable, but..............REED STRETCHES HIS WHOLE BOD He EXPANDS himself across the street, and GRABS a TREE, s forms a WALL between Sue and Doom. Doom keeps FIRING his bolts.  They SLAM into Reed's body, RUBBERBAND his skin, and DISTEND OUT his back without breaking.  He strains, agonizing.
Johnny.  SUPERNOVA.
But all these people...
Now.
Johnny charges toward Doom -- flames on his body starting build to a blinding white intensity, ENGULFING everything Johnny GRABS DOOM.
(quiet, smiling) Flame on, kid.
FLASH!  Johnny explodes in a PULSE of BRIGHT WHITE LIGHT, which starts to HEAT UP everything surrounding it.  Reed doesn't miss a beat.  He's in total command now.
Sue, I need some of that anger, rage, frustration --
(looking at Doom) I'm sure I can come up with something.

She concentrates.  She sees Johnny holding onto Doom -- a the GROWING HEAT and LIGHT. Sue shuts her eyes.  A GIANT FORCE FIELD EXPLODES FROM HE BODY.  A massive WAVE OF ENERGY.  It SWOOPS past a car, w WARPS, MELTS (half the car is not inside the force-field) Thing turns to the crowd, extending his arm, blocking the Sue's force-field ENVELOPS JOHNNY'S SUPERNOVA, containing in a BRIGHT SPHERE OF ENERGY.  The light increases, to th point that it's blinding.  People look away. Finally, Johnny's supernova fades.  He collapses to the ground, exhausted, smoking.  Sue exhales and falls to her knees.  Her force field fades.  The light flickers out. everyone's eyes adjust, we hear...THUD.  THUD.  And -- DOOM steps through the smoke.  Unharmed.  His metallic bo GLOWS WHITE, TRAILING MOLTEN METAL.  Sue, Ben, Johnny loo devastated.  They can't beat him.  He looks at Reed.
Is that the best you can do...?  A little heat...?
Reed stays perfectly calm.  He shakes his head.
Time for your lesson, Vic.  Chem 101: what happens when you supercool hot metal...? (to Ben) Ben...
Got it, teach.

He KICKS OPEN the FIRE HYDRANT.  The water GEYSERS UP!  B kicks down with his foot, deflecting the water so it spra toward Reed, who...TWISTS HIS TORSO so... The water CURLS around his chest, RACES down his arms, an SHOOTS right off his wrists toward Doom!
No.

Doom RUSHES TOWARD Reed, but the WATER FLIES OUT, DOUSING DOOM.  GIANT CLOUDS OF STEAM fill the air from the coolin metal.  DOOM screams.  His shrieks finally fade to SILENC The water stops, thick steam clouds roll, completely obscuring Doom from view.  A beat.  The steam clears to reveal: DOOM.  A true statue now -- a hard, cold solid piece of METAL.  Frozen forever.  Reed, Sue, Ben, and Johnny -- Th Fantastic Four -- exhale.  They stand as one, in roiling smoke.  A beat.
Damn, I love this job.
Reed and Sue slowly lock eyes, thinking the same thing.
Job, huh...?
Will they accept their mantle?  Reed shrugs.
Well, we do have the suits...
They give weary smiles.  A team.  Sue gets close to Reed.
You know, about what we said up there, I think maybe --
THHM!  He KISSES HER.  His neck extending.  Strong, power He pulls back slightly, smiles at her.  A new strength in him.
Funny how things turn out, isn't it?
Sue looks at Reed.  A long way from that conference room.
Hilarious.
As they kiss, people emerge, stepping out of hiding.  The rises around them.  The Fantastic Four step into the new of a new day.  And we slowly DISSOLVE TO --
Reed and Sue kiss on the deck of the Circle Line as it ch around New York City.
Dude, that's still my sister.

A PARTY IN PROGRESS.  Drinks, food, music.  We see in the crowd a familiar faces: O'HOOLIHAN (cast on his arm), bartender ERNIE, others.  JOHNNY and BEN stand behind Ree and Sue. Reed and Sue pull apart.  Reed turns to Ben, excited.
Ben, I've been crunching the numbers on the machine.  I think if we can rework the power settings...
Forget it, egghead.  I'm good as is.
That's my Benny.
She hands Ben a big METAL MUG.  Ben takes the mug.  He CLINKS, but SHATTERS her glass.
We're going to have to work on your touch.
I like the sound of that.
Alicia gets close.  A soft smile.  Reed turns to Sue.
